lead: The EU Parliament approved the climate law package with a vote of 421â€“230.
summary: The decision has sparked intense debate both for and against in various member states.
author: Maria Toimittaja

body_blocks.content: EU approved the controversial law package on climate goals
The European Parliament has approved a new law package aimed at achieving carbon neutrality by 2050.

content.caption: EU Parliament members voted on the law package on Tuesday.

body_blocks.content: The content of the law package divides opinions

The law package includes, among other things, tightening emission reduction targets and increasing new carbon sinks. Some member states consider the targets ambitious, while others see them as too restrictive.
Particularly Eastern European countries have criticized the law package's impact on the region's industry and energy production. Several countries are calling for extended transition periods.

content.caption: Opponents of the law package held a protest in front of the parliament building.
content.alt: Protesters in front of the EU Parliament

body_blocks.content: After the decision, many NGOs have expressed concern about how effectively member states will implement the new regulations.
